parts.text: {"word":"rasterized","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb (past participle)","definition":"(画像を)ラスタライズした、ラスター形式に変換した","english_definition":"having been converted from a vector graphic or other non-raster image into a raster image (composed of pixels).","examples":[{"sentence":"The text was rasterized to prevent font issues.","translation":"フォントの問題を防ぐために、テキストはラスタライズされました。"},{"sentence":"The vector image was rasterized for use in the web browser.","translation":"ベクター画像は、ウェブブラウザで使用するためにラスタライズされました。"},{"sentence":"Once the image is rasterized, it loses its ability to scale without pixelation.","translation":"画像がラスタライズされると、ピクセル化せずに拡大縮小する能力を失います。"}],"collocations":["rasterized image","rasterized text","rasterized font","rasterized layer"],"synonyms":["pixelated","bitmap","rendered"],"antonyms":["vectorized"],"related_terms":["rasterization","rasterize","vector graphics","pixel","bitmap"],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Rasterized' describes an image or graphic that has been converted into a raster (or bitmap) format, which is composed of pixels. This is often done to simplify the image for display or printing, or to prevent issues with fonts or compatibility. However, rasterized images lose the ability to be scaled without becoming pixelated or blurry.","priority":"★★★"}],"etymology":{"value":"Derived from the verb 'rasterize,' which comes from 'raster,' referring to a grid of pixels. The suffix '-ed' indicates the past participle form.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈræstəraɪzd/","syllables":"ras-ter-ized"},"inflection":{"notes":"Past participle of the verb 'rasterize'"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"The image is vectorizing.","correct":"The image is being rasterized.","note":"'Rasterizing' is the process of converting to a raster image, while 'vectorizing' is the opposite process (converting to a vector image)."},{"incorrect":"Rasterized images are better for scaling.","correct":"Vector images are better for scaling.","note":"Vector images are preferred for scaling because they don't pixelate, unlike rasterized images."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"'Rasterized' is a technical term used in graphic design and computer graphics. It refers to the process of converting an image from a vector format (which uses mathematical equations to define shapes) to a raster format (which uses a grid of pixels). Rasterized images are resolution-dependent, meaning they can become pixelated or blurry when scaled up. This term is typically encountered in contexts related to image editing software, web design, and printing. Understanding this term is important for anyone working with digital images. "},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The logo was **rasterized** before being uploaded to the website.","translation":"ロゴはウェブサイトにアップロードされる前にラスタライズされました。","type":"verb (past participle)","meaning_category":"変換された"},{"sentence":"Once the font is **rasterized**, it can no longer be edited as text.","translation":"フォントがラスタライズされると、テキストとして編集できなくなります。","type":"verb (past participle)","meaning_category":"変換された"},{"sentence":"The **rasterized** image showed noticeable pixelation when zoomed in.","translation":"ラスタライズされた画像は、拡大すると目立つピクセル化を示しました。","type":"adjective (describing image)","meaning_category":"ラスタライズされた"}]}
